title: New: Fthrsn – Nothing’s the Matter // Colors
content:
Artwork by Katai Stienstra

I did two whole Google searches after hearing the new, and only, single from fthrsn. I concluded that fthrsn is an appalling name, and that there is literally nothing about this unfortunately named producer on the Internet. He did have a supporting slot at a Zen Tapes show however, a show which CITR fave Chrome Sparks was said to have played at, so if anything, at least he’s in good company.

Despite his inability to embrace social media, his new single is actually very good. ‘Nothing’s the matter’ plods along with a set of brutal lo-fidelity production, with fthrsn grim vocals, “your love won’t keep me strong”, clashing with the blissful harmonies that float and circle the track.

The records b-side, ‘Colors’, is not so full of ideas however, fthrsn voice is weaker with the afro-pop influences coming across more one dimensional. Despite this, the work as a whole is promising. Now if we can just convince fthrsn to get a Facebook, then you’ll no doubt be hearing a lot more of him/her.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d24
